Lucy_Angel:
{{Short description|American country music vocal group}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Lucy Angel | image = Lucy Angel at Bra Country Concert.jpg | caption = Lucy Angel performing for Y100's Bra Country Concert on October 14th at the new "Backstage At The Meyer" in downtown Green Bay to benefit the Breast Cancer Family Foundation in 2015 | origin = [[Nashville, Tennessee]], [[United States|USA]] | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | years_active = 2003–present | label = G-Force | website = {{URL|http://www.lucyangel.com/}} | current_members = Kate Anderton
Lindsay Anderton
Emily Anderton }} '''Lucy Angel''' is an American [[country music]] vocal group from [[Nashville, Tennessee]]. The group consists of Kate Anderton (mandolin, vocals) and her two daughters, Lindsay (lead vocals, harmonica) and Emily (guitar, vocals). The group has charted one single, "Crazy Too", on [[Country Airplay]]. ==Music career== ===Early years=== Kate first entered the world of country music when her husband entered her into a country music talent search show, the Wrangler Country Showdown (which later became the [[Colgate Country Showdown]]), which she won. Eldest daughter Lindsay started performing at age four, and by twelve had joined her mother in singing professionally. Originally from [[Arizona]], the family moved to [[Nashville, Tennessee]], in 2003,{{Cite web|url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/lucy-angel-mn0002737815/biography|title=Artist Biography|last=Deming|first=Mark|date=|website=All Music|access-date=5 November 2019}} where Kate and Lindsay first took on the name Lucy Angel as the name of their duo.Segovia, Stacy Smith (Sep 16, 2005) "BWC's Bike Week roars into town". ''The Leaf Chronicle'' pg. D.3 Youngest daughter Emily joined her mother and sister on the stage. ===2004 - Present=== Lucy Angel's first public performance as a trio was opening for [[Neal McCoy]].{{cite web|url=http://www.musicrow.com/2011/04/lucy-angel/|title=Lucy Angel – "Serious"|work=MusicRow - Nashville's Music Industry Publication - News, Songs From Music City|date=18 April 2011}} The group went on to open for headliner acts such as [[Taylor Swift]], [[Montgomery Gentry]] and [[Charlie Daniels]]. On July 22, 2011, they performed at the Country Thunder Music Festival in Twin Lakes, Wisconsin.{{cite web |url=http://thecelebritycafe.com/reviews/country-fans-will-love-lucy-06-28-2011 |title=Country fans will love Lucy | TheCelebrityCafe.com |accessdate=2011-11-08 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110630072540/http://thecelebritycafe.com/reviews/country-fans-will-love-lucy-06-28-2011 |archivedate=2011-06-30 }}{{Cite web |url=http://emol.org/newclub/wisconsincountrythunder2011 |title=Wisconsin Country Thunder 2011 | Entertainment Magazine |access-date=2011-11-08 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120405084554/http://emol.org/newclub/wisconsincountrythunder2011 |archive-date=2012-04-05 |url-status=dead }} In 2015, Lucy Angel opened shows for Jake Owen, Kip Moore, Craig Campbell, Chris Janson, Big & Rich, Lauren Alaina, James Otto, A Thousand Horses, LoCash, The Swon Brothers and more.{{Cite web|url=https://www.sevenvenues.com/events/detail/eaglefest-2015|title = Eaglefest 2015 | SevenVenues}} Apart from touring the United States, Lucy Angel has also performed internationally, visiting Japan, Switzerland, China and the United Kingdom. In 2006, Lucy Angel performed at the 13th Annual Country Sunshine Festival in [[Kumamoto, Japan]].{{cite web|url=http://public.fotki.com/jsrefugee/2006/lucy_angel_-_countr/|title=Lucy Angel - Country Sunshine|work=Fotki - www.fotki.com}}{{cite web |url=http://www.judysealeinternational.com/artistontour_06.html |title=JSI Inc., - Entertainment Conglomerate - Artist Management, Corporate Endorsements and International Tours and Festivals |accessdate=2011-11-08 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120425121638/http://www.judysealeinternational.com/artistontour_06.html |archivedate=2012-04-25 }} In 2008, Lucy Angel performed at the Schützenhaus Albisgütli in [[Zurich, Switzerland]].{{cite web|url=http://public.fotki.com/jsrefugee/1/lucy-angel---zurich/|title=Lucy Angel - Zurich, Switzerland|work=Fotki - www.fotki.com}}{{cite web |url=http://www.judysealeinternational.com/lucy.zurich.2.22.08.html |title=JSI Inc., - Entertainment Conglomerate - Artist Management, Corporate Endorsements and International Tours and Festivals |accessdate=2011-11-08 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120425121743/http://www.judysealeinternational.com/lucy.zurich.2.22.08.html |archivedate=2012-04-25 }} Lucy Angel journeyed to China twice in 2009. The first time was in January when they gained the distinction of being the first American/Western group ever to be invited to perform at the [[Great Hall of the People]] in [[Tiananmen Square]], doing so before an audience of dignitaries and government officials."China Girls". ''Country Weekly''. April 20, 2009{{Cite web|title=News : Headlines : Country Visits Unusual Places : Great American Country|url=http://www.gactv.com/gac/nw_headlines/article/0,3034,GAC_26063_5940126,00.html|date=2012-04-01|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120401033350/http://www.gactv.com/gac/nw_headlines/article/0,3034,GAC_26063_5940126,00.html|archive-date=2012-04-01|access-date=2020-05-09}} In May 2009, the group was invited back to China for the [[Zhangjiajie]] International Country Music Week in the [[Hunan Province]].{{Cite web |url=http://en.radio86.com/news/chinas-first-country-music-festival-kicks-hunan |title = China's first country music festival kicks off in Hunan | gbtimes |archive-url=https://archive.today/20120708203829/http://en.radio86.com/news/chinas-first-country-music-festival-kicks-hunan |archive-date=8 July 2012 |url-status=dead}}{{cite web|url=http://news.cultural-china.com/20090520142453.html|title=Music unites musicians in Zhangjiajie|access-date=2011-11-08|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120507034201/http://news.cultural-china.com/20090520142453.html|archive-date=2012-05-07|url-status=dead}} ==Discography== The group's first single, "How Long", was issued in 2007. Lucy Angel released two singles in 2011, "Only Woman Left" and "Serious". "Only Woman Left", their breakout single, peaked at No. 45 on MusicRow’s [[MusicRow]] CountryBreakout chart. "Serious", their second single reached No. 31 on MusicRow’s CountryBreakout chart and made it to No. 42 on the Billboard Indicator chart.{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/the-615/465389/615-spotlight-lucy-angel-has-fame-in-reach|title=615 Spotlight: Lucy Angel Has Fame in Reach|date=9 November 2011|magazine=Billboard}} In addition, they have a holiday special single entitled "Mr. Santa." Lucy Angel's self-titled debut album was released digitally on January 13, 2015. Lucy Angel released "Crazy Too" to Country radio in May 2015. The single reached No. 51 on the Country Airplay chart. "Crazy Too" was a SiriusXM The Highway, ''Highway Find'' in November and December 2014. In 2017 Lucy Angel released a new single to Country Radio entitled "Public Pool Party", the lead single comes from a forthcoming EP project yet to be released. In 2019, Lucy Angel appeared as guest artists on the [[Ronnie Milsap]] album "The Duets". They were featured on the song "Happy Happy Birthday Baby". ==Television== ===Reality Show=== Lucy Angel starred in a 13 episode docu-series, "Discovering Lucy Angel" on AXS TV in the Spring of 2015. The show is set to air internationally in the UK on SHOWBIZ TV beginning February 14, 2016.{{cite web|url=http://www.axs.tv/press_articles/20219/|title=AXS TV'S COUNTRY MUSIC DOCU-SERIES 'DISCOVERING LUCY ANGEL' PREMIERES TUESDAY, JANUARY 13, 2015 AT 9 P.M. ET/6 P.M. PT - AXS TV|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=http://kmle108.radio.com/2011/09/16/photos-lucy-angel-up-close-and-personal/|archive-url=https://archive.today/20120711102018/http://kmle108.radio.com/2011/09/16/photos-lucy-angel-up-close-and-personal/|url-status=dead|archive-date=2012-07-11|title=[Photos] Lucy Angel: Up, Close And Personal|publisher=}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.entertainment-focus.com/music-section/music-news/discovering-lucy-angel-coming-to-showbiz-tv/|title = Discovering Lucy Angel coming to Showbiz TV| date=25 January 2016 }} [[HGTV]] featured the band on the series "Interiors Inc", during which they premiered their song "Cowboy Can."https://news.yahoo.com/lucy-angel-hgtv-interiors-inc-160249628.html {{Dead link|date=February 2022}} ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- ! style="width:8em;"| Title ! style="width:18em;"| Details |- ! scope="row"| ''Lucy Angel'' | * Release date: January 13, 2015 * Label: G-Force Records |- |} ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2" style="width:12em;"| Single !
